goals.question: What is the distribution of movie ratings?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of movie ratings and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between movie budget and revenue?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any correlation between movie budget and revenue, and determine if higher budgets lead to higher revenues.

goals.question: What is the most common genre of movies in the dataset?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of the count of each genre in the 'genres' field
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the most popular genre of movies in the dataset and potentially inform future movie production decisions.

goals.question: What is the distribution of movie runtimes?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of movie runtimes and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the average rating of movies in each genre?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of the average rating for each genre in the 'genres' field
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand which genres tend to have higher ratings and potentially inform future movie production decisions.

code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.hist(data['rating'], bins='auto', edgecolor='black')
    plt.xlabel('Rating')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of movie ratings?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.scatter(data['budget'], data['revenue'])
    plt.xlabel('Budget')
    plt.ylabel('Revenue')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between movie budget and revenue?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    genre_counts = data['genres'].value_counts()
    genre_counts.plot(kind='bar')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title("What is the most common genre of movies in the dataset?", wrap=True)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.hist(data['runtime'], bins='auto', edgecolor='black')
    plt.xlabel('Runtime')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of movie runtimes?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    genre_ratings = data.groupby('genres')['rating'].mean()
    genre_ratings.plot(kind='bar')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title("What is the average rating of movies in each genre?", wrap=True)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
